reviews.sentence: Flamingo holiday. Overall experience at Flamingo was great. The video poker and bars are excellent. The casino is active The rooms are average but comfortable. The center Cut Steak House is excellent. The overall value of the hotel is great.

A bit of Old School Vegas at a reasonable price for great Strip location. Always one of my favorite places to stay in Vegas just can not beat the location can actually walk to many attractions other casinos avoid the perpetual Vegas traffic gridlock. Obviously an older property with some updating was disappointed that the 24 hr coffee shop had closed but still a lot of energy fun. Ate at the Steak House one evening with 3 of us splitting the prime rib entree sampled 3 or 4 appetizer side dishes which were all delicious served in a timely friendly manner. The rooms were very nicely decorated with new furniture flooring non carpet thank god very comfortable beds. The bathrooms could really use some more updating bathtub faucet appeared to be ready to fall off but overall a very pleasant stay. The main thing is the friendliness efficiency of all the employees we encountered especially Rudy in Valet who went out of his way to accommodate my vehicle when garage was full retrieved it very quickly so we could leave on time for airport.

Dreary and disappointing. Returned late last week January 21 2016 from a fun vacation business trip in Vegas. The one big letdown was this hotel. Pro Prime location on the central strip The Center Cut Steakhouse Generally pleasant and helpful stafCon The room. We had a bad impression from the start. Our room 172 was at the very end of two very long hallways. The white entry door to the room was scuffed by several horizontal black marks. Inside the window had a decent view but it was filthy. The electrical outlet in the corner was cracked and could be a fire hazard No refrigerator or cofemaker although we saw two fridges parked in the hallway outside other rooms. One remained there for the entire duration of our stay. I have stayed at three Caesars properties in LV over the past several years including this one. All seem to aspire to mediocrity instead of excellence with the Flamingo being the least successful in reaching that dubious standard.

Get a Room with a Rug at Flamingo Las Vegas. The room itself at Flamingo Las Vegas was clean and the maids were quite efficient. The view out to the garden was nice and I could see the High Roller at the LINQ Hotel clearly. Sadly it was an older room and for some reason there was no rug on the floor which makes it easier to clean but amplifies any noises from the hall or rooms nearby. This being The Strip some noise could be expected but my spouse and I were unlucky enough to be next to younger people with no training in how to behave at late hours. On one night they were so noisy with extremely loud laughter and loud conversation with every 10th word being a profanity. We called hotel security at midnight and again at 3 AM. Security came by the first time we are not sure they came by at 3. We were ready to move to another room the next night in order to get enough sleep to get up early for our return flight but the front desk staff informed us that the thoughtless neighbors had checked out. The room was unoccupied that night and we slept well. The Flamingo Las Vegas is close to so many other hotels for gaming and we did like the buffet and Mexican restaurant Carlos and Charlies. The High Roller observation wheel at the LINQ Mob Museum Atomic Testing Museum Grand Canyon Skywalk in Arizona. Easy to clean rugs should be installed in ALL rooms. Something should be done to control noise from the halls and next door rooms.

The hotel was fine it has a nice location but the room I stayed in was missing the towel bars. They really should have a coffee maker in the rooms. I like the location Elevators they seemed to be malfunctioning a lot it sometimes took 30 minutes to get an elevator. Unacceptable.

Nice location. We were on 21st floor with nice view of strip. Disappointed the buffet was only open on weekends. Nice location as it is part of a little strip shopping center of restaurants and shops with no cars allowed. They have a beautiful garden area and nice casino. Rooms might need a little updating.

Fabulous time. Our room was clean perfect view of the strip and fountains. The hotel was clean in all areas I was in. Great Central location ate at the buffet. was okay. there are better ones out there. Love the pool.
I love the Margaritavile Casino and restaurant located at the Flamingo.

Rated a 5 for location 25 for rooms and 30 for everything else. I have stayed at the Flamingo 10 12 times and love the location. it is Vegas Strip Central. In close proximity to some really great casinos and great dining and across from Ceasars Palace Forum Shops. The addition of the Linq is great since they made best use of the alley way behind the casino. there is a bunch of great shops and places to eat as well as some entertainment back there. You can not beat their room rate but the rooms are average. They have upgraded rooms called Fab Deluxe that are still just average. I like the fake wood floors because they seem much cleaner than carpeted flooring. But the rooms need a big serious upgrade. The hotel is only 15 minutes from the airport. Love that. And the Flamingo is one of the oldest Vegas Hotels so that is fun. The hotel next door The Cromwell is a nice place with Giadas Restaurant in it so stay at the Flamingo but take advantage of all the great things around it.

Flamingo Las Vegas. Visiting the Flamingo was flawless. You feel right at home. Personnel are just fantastic. The spa the gardens the restaurants the service the hospitality is just wonderful. It ’s location is the best. It is Center strip and close to the best casinos restaurants and shows.

Had lunch at the Flamingos buffet. There was a nice selection of food including a salad bar pizzas a carving station tacos and desserts. Servers were quick to bring refills as well. it is an especially great deal if you get the buffet of buffets pass.

Check. In Line was too long. Express Check In did not work but an associate processed it for me. Still I did not get all the paperwork I would have got at the Front Desk. Not happy about paying for Parking but nice of you to give me the 25 Casino Credit which I used for the Buffet. Probably will not return because of high Resort Fee Parking Charge. Also did not like the Noisy AC System. Elevators were too small and took too long to call.

1 Should have a mid priced restaurant like Lindys back in the day. We are seniors and prefer restaurants in other casinos like the Hash House and Burger Brasserie. The only meals we eat at the Flamingo are at the Friday and Saturday buffet which by the way should be open for dinner more days of the wek2. There are too many people using slot seats to be on their phone and having group conversations. This is a BIG problem and should be addressed with things like signage casino seating in selected areas and having casino staff deal with this problem when they see it happening. Your slot customers should not have to ask individuals or groups to leave so they can use the slot machines3. No other issues rooms pool fitness center spa housekeeping rewards desk cashier and Diamond front desk all provide excellent service. The Flamingo is our hotel of choice in Vegas.
Very Good. A few of the bar area ’s were dirty.
Flamingo needs another casual dining restaurant. More slot machine options like Sharknado. Check in lines are very long when the vip checkin is closed. Hotel clerk was rude.

The Wyndham sales reps intercepting guests all throughout the lobby level and dining halls were a constant nuisance. One of them tried to sell us four times in the same morning. The buffet breakfast was way overpriced for the level of service provided I tipped generously and was amazed to find that there was absolutely no table service beyond a waitress constantly bugging us to see if we were finished with our dishes. The whole process for waiting to be admitted to an almost empty dining room seemed unnecessary. Dinner service and food quality at Center Cut were both very good.

Old stinks spend your stay elsewhere. The location is good if you want to be right on the strip. The hotel is old stinks and everything has an extra charge. The “ included breakfast ” is a total joke you get 9 to spend at the cafe. And if you go 1 over its charged to your room. Free wifi is only for one device otherwise again you need to pay. Wo n’t be coming back and will not be recommending to anyone.

great value acomodation on the strip with a strip view. Loved the location. Beds were very comfortable. The breakfast buffet was disappointing mostly had lunch food and very little breakfast selection. We booked into the updated strip view rooms and were a little disappointed that the windows had images on the outside which distorted the outlook of the strip when we paid extra for this view.

Very Good. Location. Breakfast facilities terrible long walk from the lift to our room made to believe the go green option of having no maids clean the room and a 10 voucher was for every day. it was nt it was for the whole stay. for 2 of us so not worth it. luckily the items for breakfast we had purchased thinking this was for every day was taken off at check out.

I have stayed at the Flamingo several times and it is one of my hotels of choice when traveling to Las Vegas. This trip was awful. I understand that with the Corona Virus it put everyone in a difficult situation but the staff did absolutely NOTHING to make guests feel safe and welcome. Upon check in the staff was ridiculously rude about early check in and only offered a room upgrade to check in early which was exactly the room I originally booked. I let them know that the room rate for total rewards was cheaper online and they said there is nothing they can do since I am already at the hotel and can not cancel or make changes. Most of the restaurants were closed without warning very few gambling tables were opened the pool was closed without warning and all of the shows were cancelled. We paid a resort fee only have most of the facilities not even available to us. We were forced to cut out trip short due to most of the facilities being closed. I was honestly so disappointed in the staff and the lack of customer service at the Flamingo that I will never stay there again.
